title: HTML Case Study: Portfolio
subject: HTML
learning_objectives: Combine all concepts (Header, Nav, Section, Form, Footer)
theory:
# Real World Case Study: Personal Portfolio We will construct the blueprint for a standard portfolio page. ## 1. Structure * **Header**: Logo and Navigation. * **Hero Section**: Intro text and photo. * **About Section**: Text and Skills list. * **Projects Section**: Grid of project previews. * **Contact Section**: A Form. * **Footer**: Social links. ## 2. The Code ```html My Portfolio
  • Home
  • Projects
  • Contact

Hello, I'm Dev.

I build websites.

Hire Me

My Work

Project A

An amazing app.

Contact Me

© 2024 Dev.

```

examples.explanation: Notice correct nesting: header/main/footer at root. section/article inside main.

common_mistakes.correction: Always wrap the primary central content in <main>.

interview_questions.question: How would you structure a landing page?
interview_questions.answer: Header with Nav, Main containing Sections (Hero, Features, Testimonials), and a Footer. Using semantic tags throughout.

practice_problems.problem: Copy the Case Study code into a file 'portfolio.html' and open it. Then add CSS to make the nav horizontal.

real_world_use_cases.description: This structure is the template for 90% of small business websites.

exam_notes: Logical flow: Head -> Body -> Header -> Main -> Footer
summary: This case study ties everything together. We used headings for structure, lists for navigation, forms for contact, and semantic tags to wrap it all up. This is a production-ready HTML skeleton.
